## SDQ vs SWAN

SDQ vs SWAN When it comes to evaluating behavioural screening questionnaires such as the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Strengths and Weaknesses of ADHD Symptoms and Normal Behaviour Scale (SWAN), scientists and researchers face a challenging task. Harmonising these questionnaires, that is to say, matching corresponding items in the two sets, is not only laborious but also a highly subjective process. Furthermore, the presence of these questionnaires in various formats and languages further exacerbates the harmonisation complexity. This is where we suggest the use of Harmony, a sophisticated natural language processing tool that excellently serves the purpose of harmonisation. Executing the task of comparing SDQ vs SWAN is made astoundingly efficient via Harmony. You can either choose the questionnaires from Harmony's extensive pre-existing database or easily upload your instruments in PDF format through a user-friendly web interface. Moreover, Harmony's capability extends to comparing items in multiple languages, thereby broadening its realm of utilization for researchers around the globe. Regardless of whether you're conducting research on behavioural screening tools like SDQ vs SWAN, or any other psychological measures, Harmony can substantially streamline your work process. By accurately providing a percentage match between each item, Harmony significantly improves research reliability in comparisons such as SDQ vs SWAN. Additionally, it offers the potential to conduct comprehensive longitudinal analyses within and across several studies, thus revealing patterns and trends that influence changing social conditions. Thanks to its large language models, Harmony provides real-time results with exceptional accuracy, making it the go-to instrument for conducting harmonisation tasks between psychological questionnaires such as SDQ vs SWAN.

## Compare the items in SDQ and SWAN

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and SWAN into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SWAN into Harmony</a> - compare SWAN with other instruments
